metadata.synopsis: As the player explore the surrounding of Moonrise, they can encounter a cat playing with a dead tadpole. Upon interacting with this cat, player can learn where the tadpoles are actually being stored at (SWA) or the location of a nearby tunnel they can use in cat form (Non-SWA). Steelclaw is a murdering psychopath who revels in blood and gore.

25.speaker: Steelclaw
25.text: Yours is a face I shred in my dreams.

73.speaker: Steelclaw
73.text: One who kicked the Steelclaw, as if I were some stray. I am a champion hunter. When I lick my pelt: I taste blood.

53.speaker: Steelclaw
53.text: Ghost dragon, harbinger of death, child of the end. The tower feared you so, but one day I shall pry you apart scale by scale.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: What do you mean I kicked you? We've never met.

75.speaker: Steelclaw
75.text: The death-walker passed through here before. I know your scent. All were silent afore you, but I dared to snarl.

24.speaker: Steelclaw
24.text: You skulked like you owned the place, trespassing on my domain.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Try to remember what was forgotten.

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *You excavate the empty caverns of your useless mind. Shovelling, dozing, blasting through the smoothbrain.*
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge closes eyes and winces trying to remember.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *How the kitty-cat mewled when your boot stamped upon its tail! You are the black cat crossing the path of the living.*
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge starts to relish in the memory, but thinking about the memory brings it into reality. The dark urge blacks out using the DARK URGE RAGE template, and by the time the template goes, the cat is dead on the ground in front of them.

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *The pleasure of the memory dribbles out of your leaking skull, into the very air...*
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark urge snaps back to reality. The body of the cat is dead in front of them.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: What is wrong with me?! Gods help me.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *A memory won at the cost of a piece of mind: you were in this tower before. That much is sure.*

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Don't risk delving into the past's horrors. Ask about the tadpole.

79.speaker: Steelclaw
79.text: I will split and burst their every skin.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: My past evils are lost to me. Now, I admire your hunt.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Those parasites are dangerous - they've harmed me sorely.

0.speaker: Steelclaw
0.text: Fortunately for you, I have grander game than you to stalk.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I wager the rats here are really scary.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *The cat pays you little attention, so focused is it on the hunt.*

44.speaker: Steelclaw
44.text: That parasite was mine. Spend your days in fear, furless one, for I will return to dig my claws into your eyes and rip out your brains!
44.context: NodeContext: full on murderous psychopath here, she means every word

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Hold out your hand, letting the cat sniff it.

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *The cat ignores you, but her eyes stray to a small tunnel hidden in the wall.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera focuses at the small tunnel hidden in the wall

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *The message is clear - stay, if you wish, but she will flee at a moment's notice.*

72.speaker: Player
72.text: This place is dangerous, you should probably leave.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The cat huffs - unimpressed. She will do as she pleases.*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You're quite the hunter, aren't you?

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Get out of here, stupid cat.

77.speaker: Steelclaw
77.text: These are the stalking grounds of Steelclaw, furless one - tread lightly.

87.speaker: Steelclaw
87.text: Fortunately for you, the slithering vermin I hunt has my attention - for now.
87.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous, hinting that she'd turn on the player in an instant

22.speaker: Player
22.text: The tower isn't a safe place right now, maybe you should leave.

5.speaker: Steelclaw
5.text: You may run with your tail between your legs, but I fear no man nor beast - particularly cowards who hide behind magic. Bah.

71.speaker: Steelclaw
71.text: It is a name I earned through bloodshed and death. Unfortunately, the more ignorant here refuse to use it.

91.speaker: Steelclaw
91.text: Their name matters not, merely their demise.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Murder every single one you find.

34.speaker: Steelclaw
34.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous, she'll kill anything in her path

35.speaker: Player
35.text: The parasites are dangerous, don't go near them.

65.speaker: Steelclaw
65.text: Do not push your own cowardice upon me.
65.context: NodeContext: disgusted with the player. She is a hunter, she will kill only the most deadly of prey

61.speaker: Player
61.text: A fellow hunter is a welcome sight. Any tips on hunting tadpoles?

7.speaker: Steelclaw
7.text: I braved lapping waters and leaking ships to find this prey. I butchered many, and will butcher many more.
7.context: NodeContext: cold and murderous but starting to get a little excited at the mention of the butchering

59.speaker: Steelclaw
59.text: But this one - this one I toy with. I slice, I tear, and when the time is right, I will bite its head off and bathe in its innards.
59.context: NodeContext: going full on murderous psychopath as her excitement builds, peaking in the last line.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I remove the vitals, turn the skin inside out, then stuff them.

58.speaker: Steelclaw
58.text: Do not mock me, braggart. Not every murderer has opposable thumbs. We cannot all create, I can only destroy.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: You know that tadpole is dead, right?

29.speaker: Steelclaw
29.text: Lies, it merely pretends. But I am a patient hunter - I will wait for it to stir, and then I will strike.

89.speaker: Steelclaw
89.text: Now, I must return to my prey. It  has been too long since it felt the bite of fear.

60.speaker: Steelclaw
60.text: You simply do not understand the hunt. True joy is the feel of screaming flesh beneath your fangs.
60.context: NodeContext: cats can't smirk,  but if they could she would be doing a hannibal smile as she described this

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Good luck with the hunt, Steelclaw.

56.speaker: Steelclaw
56.text: Luck is not needed - merely patience and a thirst for blood. Hunt fast and hunt well.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: How boring, surely you can be a bit more creative?

63.speaker: Steelclaw
63.text: Your mocking tone is a mistake, your first and last.

37.speaker: Steelclaw
37.text: Another will come soon, I have no doubt. So be silent - and do not interfere.

78.speaker: Steelclaw
78.text: I await the arrival of my next kill.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: What type of prey are you waiting for?

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I bet the rats here give you plenty of trouble.

23.speaker: Steelclaw
23.text: I am no kitten. I seek something far more challenging.

9.speaker: Steelclaw
9.text: 'Tadpole' the furless ones call them. But the name matters not, merely their demise.
9.context: NodeContext: disinterested in the details, all she wants is to murder them. Cold and deadly tone.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You clearly have delusions of grandeur.

39.speaker: Steelclaw
39.text: You clearly yearn for death - a wish I am happy to oblige. Sleep with one eye open, furless one.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: A fellow hunter is a welcome sight. What is your quarry?

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *The cat gazes at you with clear disinterest.*

82.speaker: Steelclaw
82.text: Quiet, lest I miss its cries for mercy.
82.context: NodeContext: wants the player to stop bothering her, cold and commanding

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *The cat glares at you with utter hatred - you took the tadpole, its prey, and it will remember this slight.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *The feline eyes the parasite with a glint in her eye, intent clear...*
